name: Gender in Global Contexts
description: This lecture course looks at gender relations from a global perspective, focusing on how the social, political and economic aspects of globalization affect gender relations within various (local) contexts. Possible topics include gender and international migration, women's activism in local/global perspective and post-colonialism. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/SOC231H5, SOC221H5, SOC222H5, 1.0 SOC credit at the 300 level
